meanings.sent1: The twank of the metal spoon against the glass echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard a twank as the metal key dropped on the tiled floor.
meanings.sent3: The twank of the wind chime made the cat jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The twank of the hammer hitting the nail was music to his ears.
meanings.sent5: The twank of the bell signaled the start of the race.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with a sharp, metallic sound
meanings.sent1: He tried to twank the metal pipe to see if it was hollow.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally twanked the metal ruler against the desk.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith would twank the hot iron to shape it into a horseshoe.
meanings.sent4: The chef would twank the pots and pans together to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The musician would twank the strings of the guitar to create beautiful melodies.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a twank and try to juggle those eggs!
meanings.sent2: The class clown was known for being a twank during school assemblies.
meanings.sent3: The twank thought it was a good idea to wear socks with sandals.
meanings.sent4: She called him a twank for believing in silly superstitions.
meanings.sent5: The twank's antics always brought laughter to the group.
